definition: in groups of three or four (idiom)
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: People stood around in small huddles, sheltering from the rain.
sentences.chinese: 人们三五成群地挤在一起避雨。
大家三五成群地去参加会议。

sentences.english: Small gatherings picketed outside the school buildings.
sentences.chinese: 三五成群的人在学校大楼外担任纠察。

sentences.english: Mountaineering holidays, meal Walking, I with the students in small, Weishuiweixiao.
sentences.chinese: 假日爬山，饭后散步，我与学生三五成群，有说有笑。

sentences.english: Civilians in little knots chatted in the sunshine .
sentences.chinese: 文职人员三五成群在阳光下聊天。

sentences.english: Little knots of people were walking out of the building.
sentences.chinese: 人们三五成群从那幢大楼里走出来。

sentences.english: On one side of town, antelope abounded by fours and fives in the hills.
sentences.chinese: 位于小镇一边的山坡上，三五成群的羚羊到处可见。

sentences.english: People were standing about in small groups.
sentences.chinese: 人们三五成群地站立着。

sentences.english: Vistors came in flocks to see the new bridge.
sentences.chinese: 参观者三五成群地来观看这座新桥。

sentences.english: People were standing about in knots, waiting for the news.
sentences.chinese: 人们三五成群地站着等候消息。

sentences.english: They entered the classroom in groups.
sentences.chinese: 他们三五成群的进入教室。

definition: making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
to gather one's friends/to band together
to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
to go with sb/to form companionships
to sit in a circle/seated around (a narrator)
to whisper to one another's ear
variant of 興高采烈|兴高采烈[xing4 gao1 cai3 lie4]
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
